title: Michael Scott Paper Company
description: Tension and disillusionment begin to emerge as Michael, Pam, and Ryan move the Michael Scott Paper Company into a cramped "workspace" at the business park.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's Britney bitch. And I am back, in the form of a new company. The Michael Scott Paper Company.  [tries to parallel park, hits car.] Okay. Not gonna make this one. [drives away revealing plenty of space for the Cruiser]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: LOVE the hair. [Ryan walks up driveway with blonde dyed hair]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Morning Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello! They took away my parking space but they can't take away my pride! [awkwardly climbs out of his car]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like to invite you all to come away with me, on a journey. [nips mylar ribbon with hedge clippers, it won't cut, he tears it down] Welcome! To the Michael Scott Paper Company!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So. I thought we could take the customer on a... Then. Then we could...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You realize you're not actually talking to me, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Hey Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes? Charles, you wanted me?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh, I meant, I meant that Kelly. [New receptionist walks in]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The new receptionist is also named Kelly. So Kelly Kapoor has decided to hover around my desk, so that she can run into his Charles' office every time he calls for Kelly. She thinks if she says "You wanted me" enough, he will in fact want her. It's not the worse plan she's ever had.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh, and Kelly...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes Charles? Yes, you wanted me?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay, I'm gonna call you Kapoor, okay? And you, Hannon.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: If we're changing names, can I be Erin? It's my middle name.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Erin. Okay, that's very pretty.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well you know what my middle name is? Rajani Ghana! And I hate it! I hate it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I thought Rajini Ghanda was a boy's name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are in the heart of it. [Bathroom sounds rattle the small office.] And the surge of water carries our business out to the sea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What should we do now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We wait, and hope that people show up to the pancake luncheon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know I think we've done absolutely everything you can do to prepare for the day. I've updated our contacts, I have gotten quotes from suppliers. I have sent out an E-vite for our big grand opening pancake luncheon. Six yeses, one maybe, only eleven noes. Um, and 788 not yet replieds. But of that group, 782 have viewed it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to need 800 of these, on nice bright paper. It is a coupon for unparalleled customer service. [He sets sheet between Pam and Ryan on desk. Neither takes it.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I make that one copy, and I become the girl who makes copies, and by the end of the day I'm receptionist again. And the worst part is, I like making copies. The paper comes out all warm and stuff. And it's cold in there. Cause it's technically a closet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me check. [Pulls out hunting scope] Oh nope! Clearly a hunter. Who knows how to throw an outfit together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I am taking Andy hunting after work. Not long ago we were sexual competitors. I used to hate him, hate him, hate him, hate him. I studied him, to figure out why I hated him so much.  But that blossomed into a very real friendship, as these things often do.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You should come into town this weekend man. Yeah, we'll hang out Scranton style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey you said you were gonna be out of town this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Please don't listen to my phone calls.  Yeah, she's like um, she'd probably be a Six in New York, but she's like a Seven here in Scranton. And then uh, my boss is my old boss from Dunder Mifflin. It's a small space.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Hey Jim can I get a, um-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi! [Awkward]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Hi. I need a rundown of your clients, can you get that to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What the hell's a rundown?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When did you need that rundown by?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: As soon as possible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Just get it right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Gotcha. Of course. I'm gonna dive in. To the rundown. I'll be exhausted 'cause it's like a triathlon. [At door.] Do you want to close this? Close, or keep it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know there's a ghost in this office

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A woman was murdered on this very floor in 1816. Haddie McGonagle. She was a prostitute.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Why was she in this building?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, this whole place used to be a brothel. There was a tavern on the ground floor.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's crazy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah isn't it? She was bludgeoned to death by the business end of a riding crop.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was gruesome. They say she walks these hallways. If you ever feel a tapping on your shoulder?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That could be Haddie. Begging for her life. And it could mean, that you're next.  [Taps her shoulder]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh! [Dwight and Erin laugh.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just kidding. You finding everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Just got some ice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erin [eerie voice] Erin...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, this is awkward. [Andy and Erin 'dance' trying to get out of each other's way]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oops!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh oh! Oh! Oh! [Andy improvs musical verbage]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So I'll see you guys around!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey buddy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Ryan? [Ryan watches Montgomery Flea Market ad on YouTube] Could you get to that copy from before?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Pam's better at that stuff

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is so insulting.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How is it insulting to say that you're good at something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because the thing you're saying I'm good at, is pushing a big green button a bunch of times.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm not judging it, it's like ... I could run GM but I couldn't fix a car. It's not  saying one is better than the other.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Seriously? Because it sounds like one of those is better than the other.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What the hell? [Michael closed his laptop]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen. Listen listen listen listen listen listen. I need someone to make a copy of this. Because I don't make copies, I'm the boss. Got it? I make originals.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah I make originals too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it stop it! Bickering! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Not much? What's up with you? [from bathroom above] Nah it's okay. I'm in the bathroom. Hey you been watching Damages this year? It's so good. No, you gotta tune in, it's as good as anything on HBO. [sound of pissing] Hey does blue go with tan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would someone just make the copy?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I have like, like a blue shirt? I don't wear a lot of colors, I have a lot of tan. Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just make that copy okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Seriously? This is what's so important, putting naked pictures on the desktop?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's me and my friend Jonathan from Thailand.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't want to look at your friend Jasmine's boobs all day.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You could be hot too if you made any effort. At all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like how? Dyeing my hair blond?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is from the sun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah I bet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're getting on my nerves Mom. Both of them. R thinks he's too good to be here, and P is not as much fun without Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, we can hear you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm on the phone, please. Mom, I'm gonna have to call you back. P's being a giant B.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay it's my turn.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No don't take that, give that back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Give it back for what? What're you gonna do with it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm gonna make a spreadsheet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're gonna make another "spreadsheet."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah exactly. It's my turn.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Go make a copy, secretary.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on! Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They always say that it is a mistake to hire your friends and they are right! So, I hired my best friends. And this is what I get?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey buddy, what are you up to?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, nerthing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, when I saw you talking to Erin earlier, I noticed that your pupils dilated, and your skin flushed, and I'm assuming, a little bit of blood rushed into your penis.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pffft.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, a little bit of blood rushed into mine as well, so where does that leave us?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The last thing I want to do, is step on your funk man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I, yours. So I will cede her to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, that's ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No no no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look you've been here longer, and besides, I'm a better wingman than I am a boyfriend so-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look I just want you and I to hang out so, you know. Just, [They Hi-5 badly] Boom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen up. It has come to my attention that some people in this office are not getting along with other people in this office. And I think I have come up with the reason why. This office space is too small.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. There are ... 4 corners in this room. Each corner is to be a personal space for each one of you. Whichever corner you want. And make it your own.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We could work from home.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Or you could fire one of us. Whoever has less education.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay guys, thank you for the offers. But I want you to get pumped about this corner idea. All right?  1,2,3- What are we gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: .... Corner idea?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you're supposed to say, "Rock the house."

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Rock the house!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How would we know that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey dude, you know what a "rundown" is?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Use it in a sentence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Uh, can you get this rundown for me?" [impersonating Charles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Try another sentence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "This rundown better be really good"?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know but it sounds like the rundown is really important.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Charles asked me to do this rundown of all my clients.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why don't you just ask him-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. I can't. It was like, hours ago.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What have you been doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Try it in another sentence.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Last night was crazy. Jojo? Yeah. He did a donut in a parking lot in front of a cop. And then he yells, "Hey cop, you like donuts?" then we drive off. No, he just stayed there. [Pam goes to sit in a chair in the corner.] I want that new phone. No, the other one. No the other one. No, you know which one I'm talking about it's the one, the one with the awesome browser. [More bathroom noises] No, not that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's my corner.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I thought that was your corner.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is where I work. I can't relax in the same corner where I work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So my corner's the one with the copier?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, I don't make the rules. [Pam walks out.]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah. I wish my iPod could make phone calls. No I don't want an iPhone, I know what an iPhone is.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: You started on that rundown yet?  [Looks at Jim's screen.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, this is just something I'm taking a break with.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I will get back to the rundown, uh, right now.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay, great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey you know what? Do you have a rundown that I could take a look at, just so I know what type of rundown you're looking for ?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Just keep it simple.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Keeping it simple -that's what I'm doing. But I am working hard on this one. Real hard.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: You're working hard? On this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Not too hard. Not harder than I should.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Right. I mean why work harder than you should.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey I'm here to see Charles.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Charles.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know you're a very busy man so I'll cut right to the chase. I'd like my old job back.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: I don't know what to tell you. The job's been taken.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, well, I could come back as a salesman. I have experience now.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Um.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Or I could come back as your personal assistant. You know? Sort your mail, set your appointments. I know all the people.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Personal shopper?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well it was great catching up with you. And I'll see you around the building.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm just gonna sit here for a little bit longer if that's okay. The air smells so good. I don't remember it smelling so good. The chairs are so comfortable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey! Stanley, Phyllis. Come on in. Welcome, welcome. Let me give you the tour.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I get it. [To Phyllis] You need to see more?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's really cute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. You remember Ryan [Stanley laughs deeply] And Pam is around here somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: She's upstairs talking to Charles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What for?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't know. [They shrug and leave.]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Are we staying til five?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe the Michael Scott Paper Company was a huge mistake. I should leave. I should go, and start my own paper company. That'll show 'em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get your free pancakes. They are delicious. They are nutritious. They are complimentary. [Flips a pancake. It's about 8×11 inches] Young sir, would you like a free pancake?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm texting. I don't want to get my fingers sticky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan, enough with the texting machine. Come on. And tuck in your shirt, you're the face of this company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You sorta disappeared there for a while. Where ya been?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I needed to take care of some stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's as specific as I'd like to be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, at least you're still being honest with me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's the rundown you asked for. I may have expanded some areas that you weren't prepared for.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Great. Fax that to everyone on the distribution list.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah sure. You want to look at it first?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Do I need to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. No, I just wanted to make sure, it was in the same format. So that distribution list is gonna be my...?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The one I have. I'll use the one I have.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just faxing. My Dad. A rundown.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're small, but we're eager to make a name for ourselves.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Do you have a card?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope, I don't have a card, but I'll do you one better. A little scrap of paper.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: These are terrible boss. You gotta make them in a circle so that they cook evenly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These are shaped like paper.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well I don't even want these. [Takes the rectangle pancakes out of his coat.]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'll take them for my kid.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Country roads, take me home, to the place...[Dwight is strumming the tune on his guitar] Sorry. I like that song. You're good!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was great, but it's just sort of, it's still a little choppy like. But don't worry, it's hard, it took me a while too. It's like [Andy plays Country Roads on his banjo.]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? Oh my God you heard that I'm so embarrassed. I'm like so rusty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh it's good, you're coming along. It's really technically proficient but really there's no heart or soul in it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight plays a hearty strum of the song, Andy stands and starts a banjo solo]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey you want to sing with me? Almost heaven...

quotes.speaker: {Dwight} and {Erin}
quotes.text: West Virginia, Blue Ridge mountain, Shenandoah River [Andy vocalizes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In German! Leben ist dort alt, alter als die Baume, Junger als die Berge, wie eine Brise blasend

quotes.speaker: {Dwight} and {Andy}
quotes.text: Take me home, country roads, to the place, I belong. West Virginia, mountain momma, take me home, country roads. [Erin leaves]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take it Andy! Take me home, to the place I belong, Ba bah dah duh

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You have to stop. [bangs on glass window]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Michael sits alone at the pancake table alone, the breeze blowing paper around.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I once had a dream. That I was eating a peanut butter and tuna fish sandwich. And, let me tell you something it was delicious. So the next day, I decided to make that sandwich. And in real life it is disgusting. [The phone rings] It is a disgusting sandwich. [It rings again.] And the reason I tell you this story. [phone] Pick up the phone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Miff...Michael Scott Paper Company, this is Pam. Oh, hi Russell from the pancake luncheon, how are you? Well we'd like to do business with you too! How can we make that happen?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Keep going. [Whispers]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't tell them we have free delivery! [Also whispers]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We already offered free delivery!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They don't know that!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I can offer you free delivery on any order that you place today. Okay, twenty boxes? I can do... just a second. I can do 20 boxes at 43 dollars a box. Great!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Write it down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give him a guarantee.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A guarantee of what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just say the word.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And I guarantee, that you will be satisfied! 'Cause your satisfaction is our guarantee! We guarantee it. We look forward to doing business with you too. Thank you Russell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I made a sale!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You did!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We did it !

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She did it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! [Dancing in the office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who would have thought, that the thing that would save this company would be work? And pancakes? In the end, this day definitely had its ups and downs. I realize that we don't have the biggest office. Which is a surprise, because 165 square feet sounds like a lot. But, we have people with the biggest hearts. And I think for a small company that is really [flushing] Someone went to the bathroom. That is really what's important.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Literally every song is better a cappella. Name a song.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cherry Pie, Warrant.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Better a cappella!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Name another.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Enter Sandman, Metallica.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Better a cappella.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Rebel Yell, Billy Idol

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Aw!! Way better a cappella

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.
